name: George Washington
title: First President of the United States of America
fact: Washington died in an attempt to cure his sore throat, by draining half of his total blood content over the span of a few hours.

name: John Adams
title: Second President of the United States of America
fact: Adams owned a dog named Satan.

name: Thomas Jefferson
title: Third President of the United States of America
fact: Jefferson studied Italian, Arabic, Irish, and Dutch.

name: James Madison
title: Fourth President of the United States of America
fact: Madison was 5'4" and never weighed more than 100 lbs.

name: James Monroe
title: Fifth President of the United States of America
fact: The capital of Liberia, Monrovia, is named after Monroe.

name: John Quincy Adams
title: Sixth President of the United States of America
fact: Adams was given an alligator as a gift. He kept it in the East Room of the White House.

name: Andrew Jackson
title: Seventh President of the United States of America
fact: The Democratic Party symbol originated during the 1828 presidential election, when Jackson's opposition called him a Jackass.

name: Martin Van Buren
title: Eighth President of the United States of America
fact: Van Buren was the first president born in the United States. He was also the first president to speak English as a second langauge.

name: William Henry Harrison
title: Ninth President of the United States of America
fact: Harrison gave the longest inaugural address in American history. It was 8,455 words.

name: John Tyler
title: Tenth President of the United States of America
fact: As of 2013, Tyler has two living grandsons.

name: James K. Polk
title: Eleventh President of the United States of America
fact: Polk had an operation to remove kidney stones with no anesthetic, but brandy.

name: Zachary Taylor
title: Twelfth President of the United States of America
fact: Taylor died from eating raw fruit and iced milk.

name: Millard Fillmore
title: Thirteenth President of the United States of America
fact: Fillmore was the last president not affiliated with the Democratic or Republican party.

name: Franklin Pierce
title: Fourteenth President of the United States of America
fact: Pierce's 1852 presidential campaign slogan was,"[The Democrats] will pierce their enemies in 1852 as they poked them in 1844".

name: James Buchanan
title: Fifteenth President of the United States of America
fact: Buchanan's niece, Harriet Lane, served as his First Lady.

name: Abraham Lincoln
title: Sixteenth President of the United States of America
fact: Lincoln gained a reputation for being tough when he beat the leader of a group called the Clary's Grove Boys in a wrestling match.

name: Andrew Johnson
title: Seventeenth President of the United States of America
fact: Johnson showed up to his inaguration drunk, with puffy eyes, and hair caked with mud.

name: Ulysses S. Grant
title: Eighteenth President of the United States of America
fact: Grant's father refused to come to his wedding because his fianc√©e's family owned slaves.

name: Rutherford B. Hayes
title: Nineteenth President of the United States of America
fact: Hayes owned the first Siamese cat in America.

name: James A. Garfield
title: Twentieth President of the United States of America
fact: Garfield was ambidextrous and could write in Ancient Greek and Latin at the same time.

name: Chester A. Arthur
title: Twenty-first President of the United States of America
fact: Rumors were spread about Arthur that he was born in Canada.

name: Grover Cleveland
title: Twenty-second & Twenty-fourth President of the United States of America
fact: During his second presidency, Cleveland had tumor removal surgery on a friend's yacht to avoid the stigma of cancer.

name: Benjamin Harrison
title: Twenty-third President of the United States of America
fact: Harrison was the first president to have electricity, but he and his wife would not touch the light switches for fear of being electricuted.

name: William McKinley
title: Twenty-fifth President of the United States of America
fact: McKinley ran his presidential campaign from his front porch in Canton, Ohio. He made himself available to the public six days a week.

name: Theodore Roosevelt
title: Twenty-sixth President of the United States of America
fact: While campaigning in 1912, Roosevelt gave a 90 minute speech after being shot in the chest.

name: William Howard Taft
title: Twenty-seventh President of the United States of America
fact: Taft's pet cow lived and grazed on the White House lawn. The cow provided millk for the first family.

name: Woodrow Wilson
title: Twenty-eighth President of the United States of America
fact: After Wilson suffered a stroke during his second term, his wife Edith Wilson began screening all presidential matters and deciding which were important enough to bring to him.

name: Warren G. Harding
title: Twenty-ninth President of the United States of America
fact: Harding won the 1920 presidential election by a 26.2% margin. It remains the larget popular-vote percentage win in American history.

name: Calvin Coolidge
title: Thirtieth President of the United States of America
fact: Coolidge and his wife kept a raccoon as a pet while in the White House.

name: Herbert Hoover
title: Thirty-first President of the United States of America
fact: Hoover and his wife, Lou Hoover, were fluent in Mandarin Chinese. They spoke in Mandarin whenever they wanted to keep their conversations private.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: Thirty-second President of the United States of America
fact: Roosevelt won 523 electoral votes during the presidential election of 1936. His opponent, Alf Landon, won only 8 electoral votes.

name: Harry S. Truman
title: Thirty-third President of the United States of America
fact: After his presidency, Truman began working within the Truman Presidential Library and Museum. He often answered the phones there, telling callers they were speaking to "the man himself".

name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
title: Thirty-fourth President of the United States of America
fact: In his teenage years, Eisenhower was a cheerleader.

name: John F. Kennedy
title: Thirty-fifth President of the United States of America
fact: Kennedy was routinely given shots of amphetamines to combat his severe back pain. The regimen was stopped by White House physicians who found the treatments innappropriate.

name: Lyndon B. Johnson
title: Thirty-sixth President of the United States of America
fact: Johnson owned an amphibious car. He enjoyed frightening his guests by driving them into a nearby lake, yelling that his brakes weren't working.

name: Richard Nixon
title: Thirty-seventh President of the United States of America
fact: Nixon gave Elvis Presley a badge from the Federal Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs that allowed him to enter the country with guns and drugs. Elvis later died of a drug overdose.

name: Gerald Ford
title: Thirty-eighth President of the United States of America
fact: Ford turned down offers to play football for the Detroit Lions and the Green Bay Packers. Instead, he took an assistant coach position at Yale while he applied to their law school.

name: Jimmy Carter
title: Thirty-ninth President of the United States of America
fact: Carter was the first president to be born in a hospital.

name: Ronald Reagan
title: Fortieth President of the United States of America
fact: Until 1962, Reagan was a lifelong Deomocrat.

name: George H. W. Bush
title: Forty-first President of the United States of America
fact: Bush vomited on the Prime Minister of Japan during a state dinner.

name: Bill Clinton
title: Forty-second President of the United States of America
fact: Clinton only sent two emails during his presidency.

name: George W. Bush
title: Forty-third President of the United States of America
fact: Bush reportedly read 186 books during his presidency.

name: Barack Obama
title: Forty-fourth President of the United States of America
fact: Obama was the first president to brew beer in the White House.
